intro: Pavetta yambatensis, commonly known as the Yambatensis Pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with four petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, smooth seeds.
